text: Is anyone listening to the Legendary Creature podcast?
They built a pretty hilarious Naru Meha combo deck today
Have it on my phone for today's ride to work <@U3QMCLQQG>. What's the combo?
Naru Meha + Baral's Expertise or Saheeli's Artistry or Ghostly Flicker, or probably a lot of other things.
Oh snap that sounds sweet
If a bit uninteractive. Sounds fun the first few times.
Full spoiler is up: <https://magic.wizards.com/en/articles/archive/card-image-gallery/battlebond-2018-05-25>

attachments.title: Battlebond
attachments.text: The Card Image Gallery is updated every day with the latest card previews. Battlebond releases on June 8, 2018.

text: Is that like three out of four sets in a row with Raptor companion
Yes, it was in Ixalan and Rivals
The art choices on reprints is interesting, such as the Kaladesh Negate.
Is that new art on [[Dragon Hatchling]]?

attachments.fallback: Dragon Hatchling {1}{R} // Creature — Dragon // Flying // {R}: Dragon Hatchling gets +1/+0 until end of turn. // 0/1
attachments.text:
Creature — Dragon
Flying
{R}: Dragon Hatchling gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
_"Those dragons grow fast. For a while they feed on squirrels and goblins and then suddenly you're missing a mammoth." —Hurdek, Mazar mammoth trainer_
*0/1*

text: Oh, nevermind. It's the M14 art

Even if there aren't voltron decks in your meta, when's the last time you didn't have a game with at least one Lighting Greaves or something in play? 1U to steal target greaves which is a worst case scenario is probably almost always worth, let alone the upside
Oh that bounce spell? That thing has a fine floor and such a huge ceiling.
Yeah Henry
I mean...you actually gain control of the equipment so they can't just reequip it to something else.
That's a pretty narrow, but very powerful effect on an uncommon instant.
I mean...it also combos with [[Armory Automaton]]...equip everything on the Automaton, then bounce it to hand and actually gain control of essentially all equipment on the field.

attachments.fallback: Armory Automaton {3} // Artifact Creature — Construct // Whenever Armory Automaton enters the battlefield or attacks, you may attach any number of target Equipment to it. (Control of the Equipment doesn't change.) // 2/2
attachments.text:
Artifact Creature — Construct
Whenever Armory Automaton enters the battlefield or attacks, you may attach any number of target Equipment to it. _(Control of the Equipment doesn't change.)_
_With no flesh to tire or resolve to falter, the machines soon became the Academy's preferred trainers._
*2/2*
attachments.title: Armory Automaton {3}

text: Even if it doesn't though, so many decks want Greaves or Swifties, and it winds up being almost a second copy that also removes someone else's work. And it might also grab two swords and a jitte
I'm gonna try it, see if it plays that way
And if you're against a mono-white voltron...
or [[Valduk]]

attachments.fallback: Valduk, Keeper of the Flame {2}{R} // Legendary Creature — Human Shaman // At the beginning of combat on your turn, for each Aura and Equipment attached to Valduk, Keeper of the Flame, create a 3/1 red Elemental creature token with trample and haste. Exile those tokens at the beginning of the next end step. // 3/2
attachments.text:
Legendary Creature — Human Shaman
At the beginning of combat on your turn, for each Aura and Equipment attached to Valduk, Keeper of the Flame, create a 3/1 red Elemental creature token with trample and haste. Exile those tokens at the beginning of the next end step.
_The hammer strikes. The Flame awakens._
*3/2*
attachments.title: Valduk, Keeper of the Flame {2}{R}

text: It might not, but I think it's almost always going to wind up being a second copy of a haste equipment in most blue decks with a huge upside
Right
We're recording tonight so I'm probably gonna be babbling all the shit I just wrote about it
That's ok...it'll be babbling for a much wider audience.
One card I'm surprised doesn't see more play is [[Crystalline Crawler]].

text: It's only 4k decks, and for any 3+ color deck it's an interesting rock. It's also a combo piece.

So much value in a smart player's hands

text: Charm seeker actually feels really good. Assist is hard to judge because a lot of the effects are “overcosted” but being able to get back your best or your partners best card seems good
My problem is some of them feel artificially over costed for the effect just to encourage Assist.
That definitely feels like the case for a lot of them.
Some of them, it's spot on (see Game Plan), while others are just 'look how cool!'
Which makes sense, if you’re going to have a shared mana pool mechanic, it needs to cost extra for the versatility.
So we're looking at limited costing on these.
Yes, always for uncommons.
80%* of uncommons are destined to never see the light of day beyond Draft/Sealed
I see that...
Unghf
Huh...just realized [[The Crowd Goes Wild]] is an uncommon

text: You ok there, <@U3QMCLQQG>?
Vampire Charmseeker is such a good effect. It's everything I want in Sedris but it's so expensive
I did just reread it and hadn't noticed it covered creatures too.
Yeah. There was an effect like this in Shadows over Innistrad but it exiled itself when it left the battlefield
It only cost 5 mana, so...
I mean, you're in dimir, so you could readily reanimate it.
It's just a ton of mana for back to hand
I'm in Grixis and yeah, that's how I'd probably go about it.
For the review, is it multicolor and lands? Or multicolor and artifacts, or just multicolor?
[[!Possessed Skaab]]

attachments.fallback: <https://img.scryfall.com/cards/large/en/ori/215.jpg?1517813031>

text: That's the one.
Thanks, Mason, that's it.
You can blink Skaab
I'm not doing much of that in my reanimator deck
Reanimation is my blink.
I meant that more in the general vs. specific to your deck. Just looking at ways to compare them.
When does BBD drop? June something?
June 8th
Pre-release events can be held tomorrow. I’m trying to go to one, but my usual partner can’t go which is a bummer and has me debating if I want to risk pairing with someone random.
Oh really?
Anyone remember how multicolor reviews work?
Last time it was Colorless, Artifacts and Lands together
Multicolor was split across two reviews, but here it'll be one.
Right. Got it.
<@U3L7A68JC> All the Fumble talk before? Somehow I thought it didn't target, but it does
So it's pretty shit

text: Yeah, and how often do you see a voltron creature with no hexproof
:wink:
Yeah I guess but needing that in play, mana free, etc. is too much
I think it is anyway
Look at it this way, in a voltron, if they have greeves that means they have to put it on another creature to suit up...you wait until they're done and then they go to attach greeves...got'em.
Not sure I can justify a slot for that contingency though
It's very meta dependent.
Yeah
It's not a great all around card, but it sure can be back breaking in the right meta.
just run it with [[grip of phry]]

text: It's a lot of work and really not worth it, unless you're just trying to bag on a voltron/equipment deck in your meta, and honestly, there are better ways to deal with it. It's the lure of a 'gotcha!' card.
The upside is so large as to make it tempting.
But we all should know better :wink:

From Gavin: 
“To answer a question I've been seeing pop up: Gwafa Hazid and Mangara are not on Kylem. In sets like Conspiracy or Battlebond, we've decided reprints can be from pretty much anywhere, while all the new cards are set on that world. So that's why. :) “
That’s fantastic news that really frees up their ability to reprint.
Christ, thank god, it was starting to get really annoying seeing only generic name reprints in those sets because of theme
Hasn’t that always been the case since Conspiracy 1?
Not really, in take the crown they kind of tested the waters with inquisition of kozzy
Hmm.
It’s also nice to hear them spell it out.

I feel like there was more than that even in Conspiracy 1. Like Mirari’s Wake and Reya Dawnbringer were in the set.

Doesn’t matter thiugh, having it spelled out will be good for people to reference.
Reya was part of the conspiracy and the Mirari wandered through Paliano on its way to Dominaria...
:clown_face:
She’s penpals with Marchesa.
Was wake in cn1?
Yup.
Heartless Hidetsugu was in CNS too, so they’ve been doing this for a little while.
Rout (art featuring Elesh Norn) and Inquisiton of Kozilek were in Conspiracy, the planes have already felt a little wonky. We got that sick look at Koth in Phyrexian Arena art too
uhh wtf
just catching up
but Najeela …
[[sword of feast and famine]] …
